TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed SqlAuthenticationMethod extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Describes the different SQL authentication methods that can be used by a client connecting to Azure SQL Database. For details, see [Connecting to SQL Database By Using Azure Active Directory Authentication](/azure/sql-database/sql-database-aad-authentication).

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.SqlClient.SqlAuthenticationMethod ActiveDirectoryIntegrated = int32(3)

Docs.summary: The authentication method uses Active Directory Integrated. Use Active Directory Integrated to connect to a SQL Database using integrated Windows authentication.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.SqlClient.SqlAuthenticationMethod ActiveDirectoryPassword = int32(2)

Docs.summary: The authentication method uses Active Directory Password. Use Active Directory Password to connect to a SQL Database using an Azure AD principal name and password.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.SqlClient.SqlAuthenticationMethod NotSpecified = int32(0)

Docs.summary: The authentication method is not specified.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.SqlClient.SqlAuthenticationMethod SqlPassword = int32(1)

Docs.summary: The authentication method is Sql Password.
